trans-unit.source: Represents an extension that enables the customization of the cache sharing levels, the settings of the channel factory cache, and the settings of the channel cache for workflows that send messages to service endpoints using <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Activities.Send"></xref> messaging activities.
This class is intended for workflows that send messages to service endpoints.
These workflows are typically client workflows but could also be workflow services that are hosted in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.WorkflowServiceHost>.

By default, in a workflow hosted by a <xref:System.ServiceModel.WorkflowServiceHost>, the cache used by <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.Send> messaging activities is shared across all workflow instances in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WorkflowServiceHost> (host-level caching).
For a client workflow that is not hosted by a <xref:System.ServiceModel.WorkflowServiceHost>, the cache is available only to the workflow instance (instance-level caching).
Caching is disabled by default for any send activity in your workflow that has endpoints defined in configuration.

[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/includes/crabout-md.md)] how to change the default cache sharing levels and cache settings for the channel factory and channel cache, see [Changing the Cache Sharing Levels for Send Activities](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/changing-the-cache-sharing-levels-for-send-activities.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Activities.SendMessageChannelCache"></xref> class with default factory cache and channel cache settings.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Activities.SendMessageChannelCache"></xref> class with custom factory cache and channel cache settings.
[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/includes/crabout-md.md)] channel factories, see <xref:System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory%601>.

You can choose to use only the channel factory cache and disable the channel cache by passing the `channelSettings` parameter to this constructor initialized to a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.ChannelCacheSettings> instance with a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.ChannelCacheSettings.MaxItemsInCache%2A> value of 0.

To disable the cache completely for both the channel factory cache and the channel cache, pass the `factorySettings` parameter to this constructor initialized to a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.ChannelCacheSettings> instance with a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.ChannelCacheSettings.MaxItemsInCache%2A> value of 0.
Note that you cannot turn the channel cache on if the channel factory cache is disabled.
The cache settings for cached channel factories.
The cache settings for cached channels.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Activities.SendMessageChannelCache"></xref> class with custom factory cache settings, custom channel cache settings, and a value that indicates whether to turn caching on.
By default, the cache is only available for <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.Send> activities that donâ€™t use endpoints defined in configuration.
However, if you want to turn caching on in this case call this constructor with the `allowUnsafeCaching` parameter set to `true`.
Next, add the new instance of this class as an extension to a workflow service host or a workflow instance.
[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/includes/crabout-md.md)] channel factories, see <xref:System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory%601>.
The cache settings for cached channel factories.
The cache settings for cached channels.
`true` to turn caching on; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to turn caching on.
If the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.Send> activity in your workflow has endpoints defined in configuration caching could be unsecure and therefore is disabled by default.
However, if you want to turn caching on set this property to `true`.
`true` to turn caching on; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the settings of the channel cache.
The settings of the channel cache.
Releases all resources used by the current instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Activities.SendMessageChannelCache"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the settings of the channel factory cache.
The channel factory cache represents cached channel factories.
[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/includes/crabout-md.md)] channel factories, see <xref:System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory%601>.
The settings of the channel factory cache.
